00001 #include <scheduler/process_scheduler.h>
00002 #include <panic/panic.h>
00003 #include <stdlib.h>
00004 #include <common.h>
00005 #include "../stack/kstack.h"
00006 #include <debug/debug.h>

00008 struct process_entry_t
00009 {
00010         process_t* process_pointer;
00011         int ticks_tell_die;
00012 
00013         struct process_entry_t* next;
00014 };
00015 
00016 typedef struct process_entry_t scheduler_proc;
00017 
00018 scheduler_proc* list_root = 0;
00019 scheduler_proc* list_current = 0;
00020 
00021 void schedulerInitialize(process_t* kp)
00022 {
00023         //Create and set new_process to all 0's
00024         scheduler_proc* new_process = malloc(sizeof(scheduler_proc));
00025         memset(new_process, 0, sizeof(scheduler_proc));
00026 
00027         //Set its process pointer to the kernels processing path
00028         new_process->process_pointer = kp;
00029         
00030         //Loop backs
00031         new_process->next = new_process;
00032 
00033         //Set the root and current set of the list to new_process
00034         list_root = new_process;
00035         list_current = new_process;
00036 }
00037 
00038 void swapToProcess(scheduler_proc* scheduler_entry)
00039 {
00040         process_t* old_proc = list_current->process_pointer;
00041         
00042         setKernelStack(KERNEL_STACK_START);
00043 
00044         //Swap to the next process
00045         list_current = scheduler_entry;
00046 
00047         process_t* new_proc = list_current->process_pointer;
00048 
00049         //Give me a nano!
00050         list_current->ticks_tell_die = _STD_NANO_;
00051 
00052         //Swap to the new process
00053         switch_process(old_proc, new_proc);
00054 }
00055 
00056 void schedulerOnTick()
00057 {
00058         if (list_root == 0) return;
00059 
00060         if (list_current->ticks_tell_die < 1)
00061         {
00062                 if (list_current->next->process_pointer->m_shouldDestroy == 1)
00063                 {
00064                         swapToProcess(list_root);
00065                 }
00066                 else
00067                 {
00068                         swapToProcess(list_current->next);
00069                 }
00070 
00071         } else
00072         {
00073 
00074                 //increment the counter of the time spent on this process
00075                 list_current->process_pointer->m_processingTime++;
00076 
00077                 //One tick closer to being context switched
00078                 list_current->ticks_tell_die--;
00079         }
00080 }
00081 
00082 
00083 //To anybody calling this function, remember to re-enable interrupts where applicable
00084 void schedulerAdd(process_t* op)
00085 {
00086         //Create and set new_process to all 0's
00087         scheduler_proc* new_process = malloc(sizeof(scheduler_proc));
00088         memset(new_process, 0, sizeof(scheduler_proc));
00089 
00090         new_process->process_pointer = op;
00091 
00092         unsigned int iterator = 0;
00093 
00094         scheduler_proc* iterator_process = list_root;
00095 
00096         //Loop to find the last entry in the list
00097         for(;;)
00098         {
00099                 if (iterator_process->next == list_root)
00100                 {
00101                         break;
00102                 }
00103                 else
00104                 {
00105                         iterator_process = iterator_process->next;
00106                 }
00107         }
00108 
00109         iterator_process->next = new_process;
00110 
00111         new_process->next = list_root;
00112 }
00113 
00114 //To anybody calling this, remember to re-enable interrupts
00115 void schedulerRemove(process_t* op)
00116 {
00117 
00118         //Find the scheduler entry
00119         scheduler_proc* iterator_process = list_root;
00120 
00121         for (;;)
00122         {
00123                 if (iterator_process->next == list_root)
00124                 {
00125                         return; //Cannot find the right proc
00126                 }
00127                 else
00128                 {
00129                         //Is the next process the one that needs to be removed
00130                         if (iterator_process->next->process_pointer == op)
00131                         {
00132                                 //Process
00133                                 break;
00134                         }
00135                         else
00136                         {
00137                                 iterator_process = iterator_process->next;
00138                         }
00139                 }
00140         }
00141 
00142 
00143         //Store the proc
00144         scheduler_proc* next = iterator_process->next;
00145 
00146         if (list_current == next)
00147         {
00148                 PANIC("Scheduler trying to remove currently accessed process, this shouldn't happen... DEBUG!!\n");
00149         }
00150 
00151         //Remove it from the list
00152         iterator_process->next = iterator_process->next->next;
00153 
00154         //Free it
00155         free(next);
00156 
00157         DEBUG_PRINT("Removed scheduler entry\n");
00158 
00159         return;
00160 }
00161 
00162 //Sleeps the current process on the next tick
00163 void schedulerBlockMe()
00164 {
00165         if (list_current == 0) return;
00166 
00167         list_current->ticks_tell_die = 0;
00168 }
00169 
00170 process_t* getCurrentProcess()
00171 {
00172         if (list_current == 0) return 0;
00173 
00174         return list_current->process_pointer;
00175 }
00176 
00177 int schedulerNumProcesses()
00178 {
00179         if (list_root == 0) return 0;
00180         
00181         scheduler_proc* iter = list_root;
00182 
00183         int numTotal = 0;
00184 
00185         while (1)
00186         {
00187                 numTotal++;
00188 
00189                 if (iter->next == list_root)
00190                 {
00191                         break;
00192                 }
00193                 
00194                 iter = iter->next;
00195         }
00196 
00197         return numTotal;
00198 }
00199 
00200 void schedulerKillCurrentProcess()
00201 {
00202         if (list_current == 0) return 0;
00203 
00204         process_t* process = getCurrentProcess();
00205         process->m_shouldDestroy = 1;
00206 
00207         for (;;)
00208         {
00209                 schedulerOnTick(); //Fake ticks untill the next process is brought into context. Next time this process is handled by the scheduler it will be destroyed
00210         }
00211 }
00212 
00213 process_t* schedulerReturnProcess(unsigned int iter)
00214 {
00215         scheduler_proc* iterator = list_root;
00216         unsigned int i = 0;
00217 
00218         for (i = 0; i < iter; i++)
00219         {
00220                 if (iterator->next == list_root) return 0;
00221                 iterator = iterator->next;
00222         }
00223 
00224         return iterator->process_pointer;
00225 }
00226 
00227 process_t* schedulerGetProcessFromPid(unsigned int pid)
00228 {
00229 
00230         scheduler_proc* iterator = list_root;
00231         unsigned int i = 0;
00232 
00233         for (;;)
00234         {
00235                 //If it is the process I'm loooking for break
00236                 if (iterator->process_pointer->m_ID == pid) break;
00237 
00238                 //If its the last entry and not correct then return null
00239                 if (iterator->next == list_root) return 0;
00240 
00241                 //Set the iterator to the next entry
00242                 iterator = iterator->next;
00243         }
00244 
00245         //Return what I got
00246         return iterator->process_pointer;
00247 }
00248 
00249 void schedulerGlobalMessage(process_message msg, unsigned int bit)
00250 {
00251         scheduler_proc* iter = list_root;
00252 
00253         while (1)
00254         {
00255                 //Test if this process wants to hear about this event
00256                 if (iter->process_pointer->m_postboxFlags & bit == bit)
00257                 {
00258                         postbox_add(&iter->process_pointer->m_processPostbox, msg);
00259 
00260                 }
00261 
00262                 if (iter->next == list_root) break;
00263 
00264                 iter = iter->next;
00265 
00266         }
00267 
00268 }
